title: George Frazis' baptism of fire at BOQ
text:
Thursday was the first profit results in the hot chair for new Bank of Queensland boss George Frazis. As they say in rugby league when the new kid gets pummeled by a hulking veteran's tackle: “Welcome to first grade.”

Not only was Frazis delivering a bunch of numbers showing results coming backwards, but some of the analysts weren’t using kid gloves either.

During questions, Frazis said BoQ was forecasting earnings that were not a “reduction in total earnings”. But the official guidance in the results predicted: “Lower year-on-year cash earnings in FY2020”.

Veteran CLSA banking analyst Brian Johnson went for the throat. “It’s not lost on me, George, that you did say, under pressure then, you said earnings flat, but slide 33 clearly says next year’s earnings expectations are down."

Frazis, to his credit, did then calmly refer back to the slide’s guidance.
description: As they say in rugby league when the new kid gets pummeled by a hulking veteran's tackle: “Welcome to first grade.”
